100501.name: The Zone Zapper
100501.description:
Publisher Blurb

Is is a bird? Is it a plane? No, it’s Robotnik.

It’s not unusual for Robotnik to go round messing up the Green Hill Zone. This time, however, he’s built a brand-new machine, which turns everything good into bad - even Tails! Sonic faces the fight of his life with his best friends. Will they survive and will he?

Think fast and act quickly - Sonic’s going to need all the help he can get!

100502.name: WorldSpiral: Liath
100502.description:
From the back of the box:

Liath is set in the city of Azeretus, where, for some strange reason, the flow of time is incorrect. Criss, Ithena and Tiche are long time friends and when Tiche moves to Azeretus, Criss and Ithena do not hear from her for a long time. Tiche is unaware of this fact because of the distortion of time in Azeretus. Eventually Criss and Ithena decide to go to Azeretus themselves, not knowing that return from Azeretus is impossible. And so the story begins, with Criss and Ithena in their search for Tiche in the magical city of Azeretus. During their quest it becomes clear that this is not just a simple search to find Tiche. It involves the fate of the magical city itself as well as the fate of the entire world...

100503.name: Theme Park Panic
100503.description:
Publisher Blurb

A rollercoaster ride to mayhem.

An amazing new theme park has opened on Mobius. But for Sonic and his pals it turns out to have more than the usual thrills and spills, thanks to the devious mind of Robotnik. The crazed inventor plans to wipe out all the Zones on Mobius, and this time he’s determined to succeed.

Only you and Sonic stand in his way. Are you ready to accept the challenge? If you are, get ready for the ride of a lifetime.

100504.name: Starport Planetfall
100504.description:
From the back of the book:

From routine operations to dealings with officialdom, the starports of worlds in and out of the Imperium are important places of business for starship crews and other travellers. Brokers with cargo, port officers imposing legal requirements, technicians, crewmen, tourists... a whole subculture exists within the bounds of the starport extrality fence. Whether they are seeking business or pleasure, information or goods, rumors or jobs, travellers will find them among teh landing pads and control towers of the planetary starports.

Starport Planetfall is a collection of detailed encounter tables designed to generate random encounter situations for Traveller. From the largest planetary starport to the smallest landing fields, tables and encounter descriptions give depth and detail even to innocent encounters that may have no bearing on the adventure or campaign in progress... but provide flavor, atmosphere, distractions, or even whole new adventures that will serve the Traveller referee in good stead.

100505.name: Stormin' Sonic
100505.description:
Publisher Blurb

Storm clouds over Mobius.

Sonic and his pals have never seen anything like it. All the Zones are being affected by a mysterious weather egg creating climate chaos wherever it goes. Only you and Sonic can save Mobius from a weather wipeout.

Use your skill, luck and stamina to help Sonic in this amazing gamebook adventure.

100506.name: Imperial Calendar
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
100506.description:
User Summary:

While technically it's a 365-day Imperial Calendar play-aid, it's really an artbook showcasing William H. Keith, Jr's B&W illustrations and dedicated to the memory of J. Andrew Keith.

100507.name: City of Wonder
100507.description:
Get ready to advance through the stages of history and transform your humble hamlet into a thriving civilization!

In City of Wonder you not only get to create your own city but your own civilization. Guide your civilization out of the Stone Age into the Classical Age and if you're lucky, the Modern Age. With the help of trusted advisors, explore distant lands to interact, trade, and battle other civilizations.

To advance through the ages you'll need to develop, trade, or capture scientific knowledge and technology. Level up and unlock Legends of Science and technology to progress even faster. Build a sprawling Empire and thriving civilization.

Source: The Developer Website.

100508.name: Scam
100508.description:
From the Introduction:

Scam discusses various aspects of scams, con games, and similar deceptions in the universe of Traveller. Nor does it limit the field of coverage to these criminal activities, though they are important to the supplement; the systems presented in Scam are intended to permit player-characters to attempt a wide variety of deceptions, falsehoods, or impersonations as a part of their ordinary adventuring activities. Thus the material is in no way solely concerned with enabling characters to make money off of their gullible companions. All areas of interpersonal relations which are likely to arise in a given adventure or campaign may be handled by using this supplement.

100509.name: Spellbound
100509.description:
Back of the book

An Apprentice sorceress at Susthania's School of Magic, you know you're in trouble when your unlocking spell opens everything in the school. But instead of sending you home, Suthania gives you a quest and a special ring - and suddenly you find yourself spell-sent to the Valley of Tears, stronghold of the wizard Thoren, your mission to get Susthania's spellbook back from him.
Around you, you can feel magic working, and you sense a hidden menace. Is it too late to turn back? Will you use your ring to summon aid and give up this dangerous quest? Or will you go to the cabin you just spotted and search for the missing spellbook? Danger, riches, and romance await you at every turn. Will you fall victim to the spell of evil, or choose wisely for both your heart and your wand?

100510.name: Aphrodite's Mirror
100510.description:
Back of the book

You have long earned your living as an acrobatic entertainer, traveling with your father from one kingdom to another ever sense you were a little girl. But now you are stranded in the troubled city of Najpoor; and in a place where no one has time for entertainment, stealing is the only way to avoid starvation. But even a good thief is bound to get caught, and you're no exception! Brought to justice before the minister of Najpoor, you're offered a chance to earn you're freedom by helping to earn your freedom by helping by helping to save the city from the evil sorcerer Karnak. Will you join the Ministers Wizard and the handsome young warrior Ranald in their quest to find a fabled lost city where a powerful talisman of magic, Aphrodite's Mirror is said to be hidden? Or will you refuse to help and make plans to escape the Ministers well guarded dungeons?

100511.name: Faldor: World of Adventure
100511.description:
From the back of the book:

Faldor, a primitive planet only a few parsecs from the borders of the Imperium, but remote in terms of society, technology, and culture. For centuries isolated at the behest of sociologists interested in charting the progress of cultures stranded on the world long ago and reduced to the verge of savagery, Faldor has only recently been opened to contact with traders from the stars. The hazards of dealing with primitive cultures and natural hazards require a courageous and skilled breed of adventurer to meet the challenges of this new world.

The adventures come to Faldor as part of a company trading team, making a routine call at the planet to take on cargo and check on the well-being of company employees on the planet. A routine stop on a routine voyage. But routine can be deceptive, and it's possible that some of the those who come to Faldor may never leave...

Faldor - World of Adventure lies ahead. It is a place of primitive peoples and of potential wealth. But it is also a world full of potential danger...

100512.name: Storm Rider
100512.description:
Back of the book

Your father a high elf, your mother human, you're not sure which world you really belong in. Now your father has disappeared and as his son and heir must take control of his kingdom. But the evil elf Thornstabber is challenging your right to rule because you are half-human. Your fathers special power was over lightning, wind, and rain. Are you also a stormbringer? And can you learn to master this power in time to keep Thornstabber from conquering your lands? Learning to use your power-if you have any- will take the help of a high mage. Should you seek his aid and face the challenge of the weathermakers Old Man Wind, the Blue Dragon and the Weeping Lady? Or should you trust your own swordskills and human strength against Thornstabbers elfin magic?

100513.name: Mertactor: The Volentine Gambit
100513.description:
User Summary:

The included software is for the Apple II.

From the back of the book:

The planet is Mertactor/District 268 of the Spinward Marches, located at the fringe of the Imperium. The assignment is simple and profitable - recover a flashy artifact recently taken from a representative of DerBonne Merchants, L.I.C., and return it to Baron Edkos Volentine, a corporate director. You've got two days before your passage home, the Far Trader "Arax House", is loaded with cargo and ready to leave. There's not really enough time, but it couldn't hurt to look around - the Mertactor outback is supposed to be fairly scenic, and you might get lucky. Baron Volentine could be a useful man to make happy.

"Gambit" is a term from chess, an ancient Solomani pastime, describing the early sacrifice of a pawn in exchange for a long-term positional advantage. Baron Edkos Volentine had many pawns on Mertactor to choose from, but guess who got the job?

Welcome to Mertactor.

StarCrystal is a solitaire text adventure series based on the Traveller science fiction role-playing game system. Each episode is playable separately or in sequence as a solitaire Traveller campaign. "Mertactor - The Volentine Gambit" features five non-player characters, 200 locations, 380 interactive objects, and incidental graphic support. Playing time is 10-50 hours. The package contains a program disk, a data disk, and this booklet of documentation and Traveller background information. The game is absolutely playable by thouse who are not familiar with the Traveller system.

Traveller is Far Future Enterprises registered trademark for its science fiction role-playing game set in the far future. Software by Ba'rac Limited. Both are used by permission.

100514.name: Ghosthunter
videogamehonor: 2005 British Academy Game Awards Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
100514.description:
From the back of the box:

Officer Lazarus Jones, of the Detroit Police Department, never believed in ghosts.

But that was yesterday...

- Hunt and be hunted in the realms of the dead
- Experience an unparalleled fusion of gameplay and mind-blowing special effects
- Discover unique monster, mutants and ghouls that will scare you to death
- This is survival horror...evolved

100515.name: Blood Fever
100515.description:
From the developer's website:

Darko is a vegetarian vampire and loves soy blood.

He was just thrown out of his favourite soy blood bar and outside his monster buddies are lurking. That was the last straw. Our naturally very peaceful vampire Darko is now upset...

Help Darko to fend off everything that wants to touch his coffin.

100516.name: McFarlane's Evil Prophecy
100516.description:
From the back of the box:

McFarlane's Monsters Come To Life!

Based on Todd McFarlane's series of monsters action figures, Evil Prophecy sets players on an action packed adventure to hunt down the six great monsters. Armed with unique fighting abilities and lethal combo attacks, hunting down evil has never been this thrilling!

- Intense combat featuring deadly weapons and special attacks
- McFarlane-designed player characters and monsters, including Dracula, Werewolf, Mummy, Sea Creature, Frankenstein and Voodoo Queen
- Six expansive game worlds to explore with multiple stages
- 2-4 simultaneous modes for exciting co-op style gameplay
- Unlockable art gallery and interviews with Todd McFarlane
- Cool double-sided Mini-Poster included within manual

100517.name: Splatter Master
100517.description:
From the back of the box:

An exilarating action game with a cruel but soft-hearted main character.

- The wizard Jagodd has conquered the village and created an army of followers using an ancient forbidden art. Only one lone scarecrow did not yield to his wishes!
- The scarecrow can use the power of his punches or a pair of chainsaws to get rid of any obstacle.
- At the end of each of the seven levels humongous bosses are waiting for you! Once a game is over, there is still lots of fun in store!

100518.name: Realm of the Dead
100518.description:
From the back of the box:

Three fearless heroes are all that stand in the way of a mysterious disease that is turning the living into a horde of bloodthirsty zombies. Charged with carving a path through the undead, you must rescue a noble Count and uncover an evil conspiracy that threatens to tear apart the land and bring chaos to the entire realm!

100519.name: Headhunter
100519.description:
From the back of the box:

The future is a dangerous place, especially when you don't know where you are, who is trying to kill you and why. It's California in the early twenty first century, human capital has a new meaning and leading the war against crime is the AGN, an elite force of privatised law enforcers known as the 'Headhunters'. In a truly interactive world you play the part of leading renegade headhunter Jack Wade who must embark on a journey of truth and justice, rediscover his identity and turn the criminal tide.

100520.name: Johnny Platform's Biscuit Romp
100520.description:
Play as Johnny Platform himself in this retro-styled platformer! Do death-defying double-jumps and solve puzzles in your quest to defeat the evil robot army… and don’t forget to drink plenty of coffee along the way.

JPBR started out as a DS homebrew game, and was later ported to Xbox Live Indie Games. Development time for both versions combined was around 2-3 weeks, so it’s a little rough around the edges but still plays nicely. The Xbox version comes with 5 extra levels, plus some re-ordering of the existing levels for difficulty balancing.

Source: The Developer Website.

100521.name: Kingdoms of Camelot
100521.description:
King Arthur welcomes you to the dynamic world of Kingdoms of Camelot®, where your cunning and hard work will bring you great wealth, armies and land. Grow your kingdom and conquer your opponents in battle, and eventually you'll rule all the land. Check out the game millions of players are raving about!
- Grow your kingdom by building castles, barracks and more
- Build farms, mines, sawmills and quarries to gain resources to support your kingdom
- Raise an army by training your cavalry, militiamen, swordsmen and archers
- Complete quests and attack other players to increase your power
- Conquer wildernesses and barbarian camps to increase your kingdom's riches
- Join an alliance to protect your kingdom against enemies

Source: The Developer Website.

100522.name: Dino Cap
100522.description:
User Summary

A run-and-gun shooter in which you mow down evil dinosaurs in increasingly larger waves. The game features two game modes: a level mode, in which you kill dinos and earn cash to buy new guns for the next level; and a time survival mode, in which you run through the jungle and grab weapons and ammo that appear.

Dino Cap features an enormous arsenal of weapons, from the long range to the short range.

100523.name: Deathfall
100523.description:
Deathfall is a macabre, artistic experience with physics-based controls and endless levels. Now available in full HD and retina for iPad and iPhone 4!

Controls

Hold the device upright. Tilt to move.
Collect relics.
Avoid spikes.




Advanced

Collect all relics in an area for a Perfect.
A Perfect will cause you to glow briefly.
Collect relics while glowing for bonus points.




Featuring

Unique visual style.
Game Center Leaderboards & Achievements.
Physics engine
Facebook & Twitter
Dynamically generated Levels




Source: The Game Website.

100524.name: Misplaced
100524.description:
See if you have what it takes to play in a world of physics!

Misplaced is a physics puzzle game where the object is to get something back where it belongs.

When each level starts you will see the object that is lost and where it needs to go back to (like a ball and a flag).

You drag pieces around the world to try create a winning combination that will get the object to the goal when the start button is pressed and gravity takes over.

Source: The Publisher Website.

100525.name: In the Footsteps of a Hero
100525.description:
From the Background:

Adventure has forever been a distant thought for one like you. You are not a Warrior. You are not a Wizard. You are simply a young lad working at the stables in Port Blacksand, under the care of your guardian-tutor, the stableman.

A kind and goodly fellow, the stableman has looked after you for more than a decade, teaching you to ride and take care of horses. You have worked hard, receiving only meagre wages for your exhausting duties. But you have no complaint, for the stableman, himself, is scratching a living. Nonetheless, you are still well fed and allowed to stay in a small living area above the stables, which is ultimately better than the grubby inns of Blacksand. Best of all, the stables overlook a training ground.

Some time ago, a sergeant of the despicable City Guard, deemed it necessary to train and discipline Lord Azzur's troops. The idea didn't get very far, of course. Most of the soldiers merely lazed around or sat yawning with boredom till each session was over. The sergeant left the city without ever knowing of his greatest pupil.

From a young age, you have dreamt of an adventurous life in the outside world but felt too unprepared. In the time you had to spare, you would constantly spy on the training ground from your window upstairs when a session was in progress. You watched, learned then practiced the art of swordplay and combat manoeuvres in the confines of your room.

Years past.

Now, growing into adulthood, you find that your arduous work has built up your strength and confidence. What's more, you require less sleep to regain energy, and that means more hours to continue your self-training. Soon you will be ready to join the world's heroes on a path of adventure.

100526.name: A First Class Murder
boardgameversion: Paul Lamond A First Class Murder
100526.description:
Flossie Carrington had it all - she was young and beautiful, she was the heiress to an American steel empire, and she was married to a handsome ex-Guards officer. But last Thursday, the nation was shocked by the discovery of her body, stuffed under the seat of a first-class compartment on the Plymouth Express. She had been stabbed to death and her fabulously expensive jewels were stolen.

Flossie's father promptly called in Hercule Poirot to investigate. And now he has summoned all those concerned with the case to reveal what really happened that fateful afternoon. One - or more - of you around this table is a murderer. And your task is to discover who that is.

This is the new edition of A First Class Murder, with a new plot and new characters, based on a couple of Agatha Christie's mysteries.

100527.description:
Claustrophobia: De Profundis is an expansion for Croc's Claustrophobia that adds more components and more choices to the game without adding many new rules.

New components include a 52-card deck with new talents for the Brother Redeemer, new demons, new events, new objects; ten new room tiles, with six new types of rooms (sanctified zone, demon pit, tomb of the ancient warrior); four painted figures and additional markers; and twelve new scenarios with playtimes ranging from 30 to 90 minutes.

As for new rules, the demon player's hand size is reduced to three (due to powerful new event cards), Siccaria skills are now permanent, and a new beast is introduced.
100527.name: Claustrophobia: De Profundis

100528.name: Spel! (Jaargang 13, nr 2 - dec 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Niet Stuk te Krijgen: Merchant of Venus
SPIEL, Deel 2: De top-10 van Fairplay
Sporen op Tafel - deel 14: Days of Steam
100528.description:
Spel!
Jaargang 13, nr 2, december 2009
(Year 13, Issue 2, December 2009)

In this issue the first Spel!enkaart was included, the game Can the Sardines, courtesy of the author Fred Horn.

Contents:

Algemeen (General)

Voorwoord
Op bezoek bij... Albert Veldhuis
Kolonisten van de Lage Landen
Erratum beoordeling Day & Night
Agricola wint NSP
Spel!enkaarten
WK Ticket to Ride
Bevriende Winkels/Colofon




Beursspecial (Convention special)

Pokémondag
GenCon
SPIEL (deel 1 t/m deel 4)
Crisis
DuZi
LPLG
Het Spellenspektakel
Fotopagina SPIEL/Spellenspektakel




Bordspellen (Board games)

Niet Stuk te Krijgen: Merchant of Venus
Het Achtste Wereldwonder
Monuments
Sporen op Tafel - deel 14: Days of Steam
Stenen Tijdperk
Bakong
Cavum
Pandemie
Kaarten, Kaarten, Kaarten...
Met Sneltreinvaart door de Geschiedenis
Race the Wind
Rice Wars




Bordwargames (Board wargames)

Battlesmagazine
Starfire
Paukenslag




Miniaturenwargames (Miniatures wargames)

Fast and Dirty
Space Hulk (3rd Edition)
Ambush Alley
Battleground Historical Warfare Basic Game




Rollenspellen (Role-playing games)

Van Kerkers en Draken, afl. 2
Rogue Trader
Eclipse Phase
Star Wars LARP




Verzamelspellen (Collectable games)

MagicMania: Zendikar
Battlestar Galactica CCG




Note: the page count of the magazine includes the front cover (which is page 1). Articles start at page 2.

100529.description: Kung Fu U 2 is an expansion to Kung Fu U. Players use fighting cards to battle each other in Kung Fu matches. This expansion adds several new fight moves, defense techniques, opponent holds, and special attacks. New characters are added as well which are fully compatible with the characters in the first game.
100529.name: Kung Fu U 2

100530.name: geoDefense
100530.description:
Something exciting and new in the Tower Defense genre! The geometric vector creeps are fast and intense. With 30 different maps, each its own puzzle, you'll have to work fast to keep up.

Using exciting vectorized graphics, this highly kinetic games brings a whole new dimension to the Tower Defense. Devastate creeps with blasters, lasers and missiles and watch their energy debris swirl through the gravity wells of your vortex towers. Now it's time to figure out how to put that absorbed energy to good use....

geoDefense is a Thinking Man’s Action Tower Defense. Though the controls are familiar, the gameplay is decidedly different: You have to develop a strategy and, at the same time, execute in real-time when things are moving fast.

Think of it like Chess. There is your opening moves, which are setting the stage for how you will win the level. The middle game is where you do your busy work of getting built-up for the final push at the end. The end game is where it gets completely crazy! If you didn’t have a strategy up until this point, no amount of fast fingers will save you.

Sounds hard? It is... be very rewarding when you win! And every level is beatable.... there are the quick, and there are the dead. Which are you?

FEATURES

Classic Tower Defense game play
Easy to Play, but Very Tough to Master!
Fast Arcade Action
Ideal Touch Tower Defense Interface
Tutorial Screens as you go, shows you how to play (but not all the secrets!)
5 tower types with 7 levels each
Introducing the Vortex Tower! Find out how even the debris from destroyed creeps can become an essential part of your strategy
30 levels, each its own puzzle with its own rules.
Auto-saves game if you press Home or are interrupted by a call
Your music will play in the background
Free updates!




Source: The Game Website.

100531.name: geoDefense Swarm
100531.description:
goeDefense created a whole new style of Tower Defense... fast, frenetic, kinetic and strategic all at the same time. And geoDefense Swarm ups the ante with even more action, and more options. With geoDefense Swarm there are no paths except for the ones you make. And you have to think ahead, because Tower placement can be critical.

FEATURES:

The classic geoDefense frenetic action!
Easy to Play, but Very Tough to Master!
No paths... build a maze of towers!
Ideal Touch Tower Defense Interface
Tutorial Screens as you go, shows you how to play (but not all the secrets!)
6 tower types with 7 levels each
Introducing the Vortex Tower! Find out how even the debris from destroyed creeps can become an essential part of your strategy
New: The Thump Tower! Shockwaves of damage to anything that comes close!
30 levels, each its own puzzle with its own rules.
Auto-saves game if you press Home or are interrupted by a call
Your music will play in the background




Source: The Game Website.

100532.name: geoSpark
100532.description:
Get ready for geoSpark – a collaboration between the acclaimed developers of geoDefense and Harbor Master. It’s the fastest game on the App Store!

An assortment of colorful neon Sparks are flying across the screen, and it’s your job to prevent any two different Sparks from colliding. Chain similar Sparks together by dragging them with your finger. The more Sparks you eliminate at a time, the more points you get.

But be careful! As your chain gets longer, your finger becomes a gravity well that draws all nearby Sparks inwards, adding even more entropy to the mix.

Be on the lookout for bonus Sparks with special powers – they’re the key to mega success. See how high you can score, then brag to your friends via OpenFeint!

geoSpark: all the spectacle and style you expect from the geoDefense series, with the addictive, casual gameplay of Harbor Master.

FEATURES

Super fast, pick-up-and-go play style!
Easy to Play, but Very Tough to Master!
All the geo-Style visual zazzle you expect!
Fast Arcade Action
Auto-saves game if you press Home or are interrupted by a call
Your music will play in the background
Free updates!




Source: The Game Website.

100533.name: Zone Rangers
100533.description:
Publisher Blurb

All zones on nightmare alert.

Robotnik is turning all the zones into a living nightmare of pollution and destruction. His Mobius mega trash plan can only be stopped by Sonic, Tails, and you!

You have to use all your speed, skill and wits to help Sonic save the day. But time is of the essence, as Mobius is decaying with every second. Are you ready for the challenge?

100534.description: Runes 2 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 2 adds the Magical Schools of Necromancy and Elemental Earth to the game.
100534.name: Runes 2

100535.description: Runes 3 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 3 adds the Magical Fields of Conjuration and Elemental Air to the game.
100535.name: Runes 3

100536.description: Runes 4 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 4 adds the Magical Fields of Wizardry and Elemental Fire to the game.
100536.name: Runes 4

100537.description: Runes 5: Mystic Items is an expansion to Runes, which adds cards to the game which modify the battle system. The expansion comes with 30 cards, each depicting a magic item, armor, or weapons which the players must purchase to use. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 5 is the only expansion to not offer new characters or spells, instead featuring only the Mystic Item Cards.
100537.name: Runes 5: Mystic Items

100538.name: One Infinite Tunnel
100538.description:
Deep in unexplored space, you’re spaceships controls brake down while exploring a massive underground tunnel complex. With just one engine working to control your tilt, how long can you survive before you smash into the hard rock?

One Infinite Tunnel features gorgeous 3D graphics, “one button” controls and, well, one infinite tunnel. Compete against the world on Game Center and OpenFeint.

One Infinite Tunnel works on all iPhones, iPod Touches and iPads.

One Infinite Tunnel is OpenFeint enabled and is available on the AppStore.

Source: The Game Website.

100539.name: MultiPong
100539.description:
A luxurious conception for frantic games, up to 4 players on iPad and up to 2 players on

iPhone and iPod touch.

The HD graphic designs and the ultra-realistic physical engine will make you feel like playing on an old wooden board.

A classic already !

One finger to control your paddle. Give your ball smooth effects and thwart the traps to win the game !

In Multiplayer mode, catch the bonuses, use the bumpers and beat your opponents.

In Solo mode, try to beat A.I computer and defeat Mr Monster, from standard skin to 8bits skin, or try to beat your score and share it through the Game Center.

Don't lose control of the ball !

Source: The Game Website.

100540.name: Pixel City Skater
100540.description:
"Grab your skateboard and enter Pixel City. Skate through the dangerous city streets where a single mistake results in instant death!" The game is a simple one-button-game where you control a skateboarding pixelstyle character through 59 stages.

Source: The Game Website.

100541.name: Brickshooter Egypt
100541.description:
Unravel the mysteries of ancient hieroglyphs that will help you restore the glorious pyramids. A totally new brain-teasing puzzle experience across 60+ exciting levels with stunning graphics and amazing sound is what Brickshooter Egypt has to offer. Truly original, innovative and extremely addictive gameplay will keep you moving these bricks for hours on end. Crack the intriguing puzzles of the past and unlock the secrets of the pharaohs!

FEATURES

5 ancient pyramids and the mysterious Sphinx statue to rebuild
60 captivating levels of revolutionary new puzzle experience
Stunning ancient Egypt-style graphics and music
Difficulty increases with 2nd and 3rd replay!




Source: The Game Website.

100542.name: Mushihimesama Futari
100542.description:
User Summary
This is a port of the arcade "bullet hell" (danmaku) shoot-em-up by Cave. The game consists of five vertically scrolling levels of intense bullet hell action.

The Xbox 360 port comes with numerous play modes, each with an Original, Maniac, and Ultra difficulty setting.

100543.description:
Ever dreamt about being a yakitori chef? Serving up meat and veg skewered, Japanese-style, onto sticks? Grilling on the open flames and hot coals while the sweat drips down the back of your neck and the customers get more and more merry? No? Well now’s your chance to give it a go anyway. Maybe playing “Yakitori” will be the first step on a life changing career change!

Yakitori is a card game for 2-4 players. The aim of the game is to gather the ingredients to put together sticks of meat and veg before cooking them and serving them up to customers. Each customer wants something different – from quail eggs to beef, from asparagus to chicken, carefully seasoned with salt or sweet dark “tare” sauce.
100543.name: Yakitori

100544.name: Manuale Bene Gesserit: Supplemento #2
100544.description:
User Summary
This is the 2nd supplement for Imperium.

Italian Introduction
Visto dell'esterno, l'ordine del Bene Gesserit offre l'apparenza di un'immensa istituzione religiosa, presente in tutto l'Impero – una sorta di chiesa interstellare, dai ranghi interamente composti di donne.

Google translation
Viewed from outside, the order of the Bene Gesserit has the appearance of a huge religious institution, present throughout the Empire - a sort of interstellar church, entirely composed of women from the ranks

100545.name: Galleria di PNG
100545.description:
User Summary
A supplement for Imperium.

Italian Introduction
Questo supplemento vi propone i profili standard di undici personaggi-non-giocatori, che possono essere utilizzati dal direttore di gioco per rappresentare le caratteristiche e le competenze dei vari personaggi di secondo piano.
La maggior parte di essi sono assai meno competenti di un personaggio-giocante esordiente, non avendo beneficiato né del capitale di punti di Evoluzione accordato ai personaggi-giocanti che sono (per definizione) degli individui eccezionali. Solo i tre profili di personaggi condizionati (Dottore Suk, Mentat e Sorella del Bene Gesserit), possiedono delle caratteristiche e delle competenze equivalenti a quelle di un personaggio-giocante appena creato.

Google translation
This supplement offers standard profiles of eleven-non-player characters that can be used by the Game Director to represent the characteristics and responsibilities of the various characters in the background.
Most of them are far less competent debut playing a character who, not having received no capital given to points of evolution-playable characters who are (by definition) of outstanding individuals. Only three profiles of people affected (Doctor Suk, Sister of the Bene Gesserit and Mentat), possess the characteristics and skills equivalent to those of a character who is playing just created.

100547.name: Sardaukar!
100547.description:
User Summary
A supplement for Imperium.

Italian Introduction
I terribili Sardaukars imperiali vengono selezionati dall’infanzia e vengono sottoposti ad un condizionamento che li trasforma in fanatici combattenti di élite, privi di ogni umanità.
Normalmente, un tale ruolo è rigorosamente riservato ai PNG ( ma, si sa, il mondo è bello perché è vario...) Questo articolo vi dà dunque tutte le regole necessarie per creare un personaggio generato dal più terribile esercito dell'universo conosciuto.

Google translation
The terrible Imperial Sardaukars childhood are selected and undergo a conditioning that turns them into fanatical fighters elite devoid of all humanity.
Normally, such a role is strictly reserved for PNG (but, you know, the world is beautiful because it is different ...) So this article gives you all necessary rules to create a character generated by the most terrible army of the known universe.

100548.description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It was published at publisher Facebook profile.
100548.name: Paperclip Railways: Great Forest

100549.name: Crimson Empire
100549.description:
User summary

The Crimson Empire rulebook is available in a numbered limited edition softcover version (1000 copies printed) that comes with a GM screen. The GM screen front panel has roughly A4-size like the book itself, while the left and right panels are only half-sized pages.

The book contains:


Character creation and advancement rules
Combat rules
Equipment
Spell usage rules and magic item creation
Sanity rules
A bestiary
GM advice
Setting information about the world of Thargos.

100550.name: Weather Deck: Winter
100550.description:
From the Back of the Box:

How many times have you hear the comment, "Another beautiful day here in fantasy-land!" from a player? Now, you can have realism in your world. Every day's weather can be different. From calm days to blizzards, it's all here.

The weather deck is a roleplaying supplement for the D20 system. Use this deck to determine the weather in your world.

100551.name: Aventurisches Archiv: Sammelband I
100551.description:
User summary

Aventurisches Archiv - Sammelband I (Aventurian Archive - Collected Volume I) is a collection of articles from the issues 23 to 61 of Aventurischer Bote. It covers the in-game years 13 to 26 Hal which translates to the real-life years 1989 to 1996. In addition to the articles it gives a brief overview of each game year.

100552.name: Manuale Suk: Supplemento #4
100552.description:
User Summary
The 4th supplement for Imperium.

Italian Introduction
Con l'ordine dei Mentat, la Gilda Spaziale ed il Bene Gesserit, il collegio di medicina Suk costituisce una delle più grandi scuole di condizionamento dell'Impero. Esiste solamente una sola scuola Suk: è localizzata su Kaitain, la capitale imperiale. I suoi adepti costituiscono indiscutibilmente i migliori medici dell'universo conosciuto- i più competenti, più saggi, ma anche i più affidabili, un criterio di un'importanza cruciale in un mondo dove la corruzione ed il tradimento sono moneta corrente.

Google translation
With the order of Mentat, the Spacing Guild and the Bene Gesserit, the Suk College of Medicine is one of the largest schools of packaging empire. There is only one school Suk: Kaitain is located on the imperial capital. His followers are unquestionably the best doctors in the known universe-the most competent, wiser, but also more reliable, a crucial criterion in a world where corruption and betrayal are common currency.

100553.name: Die Sonnenscherbe
100553.description:
(from the back of the book)
The city of Fasar and the intrigues of the Sublime can quickly lead to dangerous and unexpected complications of a heroe's life, if the wrong way is chosen. On the other hand, this risk also involves enormous opportunities for fame and fortune. And so the heroes get involved in the conflicting interests of dwarven adventurers and self-proclaimed heirs to the Wizard Moguls on the trail of a mighty artifact.

100554.name: Ein Stein im Nebel
100554.description:
(from the back of the book)
While the eyes of the empress and her court are directed to Almada and the conflict on the Yaquir, another threat grows - unnoticed - in the northwest of the kingdom.
Paralyzing uncertainty dominates much of the Greifenmark and is discharged in the spring of 1034 BF in turmoil. The heroes are drawn into a web of ancient oaths and new feuds. Old nobility, war lords of the Wildermark, Orcish collaborators and not least a darker shade from the Finsterkamm vie for power - and there's no sign who will prevail. What started as a courtly intrigue, extends now to bloody battles that threaten not only to devour Lichthag but the Markgrave country.

100555.name: La Via Del Potere: Supplemento #6
100555.description:
User Summary
The 6th supplement for Imperium.

Italian Introduction
Nell'universo di Imperium, il termine nobile, viene applicato exclusivamente ai membri della famiglia dirigente di una Casa maggiore (chiamata anche "Casa nobile" o "grande Casa"). L'insieme di queste famiglie costituiscono la nobilta imperiale, chiamata anche aristocrazia o, se si preferisce un lessico piu "socioeconomico", classe degli imprenditori interplanetari.
E importante non confondere le Case nobili con le Case cosiddette minori.

Google translation
Imperium universe, the word noble, is applied to family members exclusivamente director of a major House (also called "Casa Noble" or "big house"). Together these constitute the nobility of the imperial family, also called aristocracy or, if you prefer a more vocabulary "socioeconomic" class interplanetary entrepreneurs.
It is important not to confuse the noble houses with the houses so-called minor.

100556.name: Frantic Frankfurt
100556.description:
The fastest solo realtime solitaire game with just 2 rules for discarding.
Based on the cardgame Frantic Frankfurt by Günter Burghardt.
4 different singleplayer modes to play:
- Endless: Discard cards as long as you can stand the stream of new cards dropping on your piles with increasing speed.
- 60 Seconds: Be the best in just 1 Minute.
- 60 Cards: Discard 100 cards with as few moves as possible.
- Training: Learn the discarding rules with your personal tutor.
2 different 2-player modes to play via bluetooth or internet:
- Endless
- 60 seconds

100557.name: Aborea
rpgissuearticle: Der Einstieg in neue Welten - Einsteigerfreundliche Spielsysteme
100557.description:
User summary

The Aborea box contains all the necessary rules and background information in a beginner-friendly format.

100558.name: Manuale Del Bene Tleilax
100558.description:
Italian Introduction
Questo supplemento riguarda il Bene Tleilax e la sua influenza nell'universo di Imperium, così come la cultura Tleilaxu in generale. Tenuto conto del grado di mistero che avvolge il Bene Tleilax nella saga di Dune di Frank Herbert, questo Manuale contiene inevitabilmente una parte di estrapolazione personale; il suo contenuto tiene tuttavia conto di tutte le notizie che mi è stato possibile estrarre dai romanzi della saga e si appoggia anche sulla Dune Encyclopedia di Willis McNelly. Più di qualsiasi altro supplemento per Imperium, il Manuale Tleilaxu è riservato rigorosamente al direttore di gioco e non è adatto a finire nelle mani di tutti, a cominciare da quelle dei giocatori. Sebbene i Tleilaxu, che sono dei “villain“ perfetti, siano destinati principalmente al ruolo di personaggi-non-giocanti, le regole proposte in questo Manuale potranno permettere ad un direttore di gioco ingegnoso di creare una
campagna che mette in scena dei personaggi-giocanti che appartengono a questa setta di biotecnologi e di ingegneri sociali senza scrupoli.

Google translation
This supplement to the good Tleilax and its influence in the universe of Imperium, as well as Tleilaxu culture in general. Given the level of mystery that surrounds the Good Tleilax in the saga of Frank Herbert's Dune, this manual contains inevitably a part of mining personnel, the content, however, takes into account all the news that I was able to extract from the novels of the series also relies on the Dune Encyclopedia by Willis McNally. More than any other supplement for Imperium, the Handbook Tleilaxu is strictly reserved to the director of game and is not suitable to get into the hands of everyone, beginning with those of the players. Although Tleilaxu, which are the "villain" perfect, are intended primarily to the role of non-playable-characters, the proposed rules in this Guide will allow a manager to create a clever game
campaign, which portrays the characters-player characters that belong to this sect of biotechnologists and ruthless social engineers.

100559.name: Imperium: Scheda del Personaggio
100559.description:
Italian Introduction
A Character Sheet for Imperium

100560.name: Imperium: Scheda degli Xenomorfi
100560.description:
Italian Introduction
A Character Sheet for Imperium

100562.name: Bylina & Bogatyr
100562.description:
User summary

Bylina & Bogatyr is a 1KM1KT game by Jared Sorenson. It seeks to emulate the great heroes of 11th century Russian folklore. It uses a simple 3d6 mechanics where multiples of 3, an important number on Russian folklore, are successes.

This PDF includes historical background, character creation, contest resolution, and folkloric creatures.

100563.name: Gamor's Tremble
100563.description:
From the Background:

You are a travelling salesman. For fifteen years you have travelled the width and length of England attempting to use your skills to sell various products. Successful, professional, wealthy, intelligent with good looks and a wicked smile, you have done well in your career and are respected by your colleague's.

As you drive through the storm down the dark country lane in Suffolk you curse your bad luck at being caught in the storm. Wiping your hand across the windscreen that is steaming up you take a quick look at your mobile phone. There us still no call or text message from John. Where is the cottage? It must be around here somewhere?

As you look up from the phone you scream in shock at the pale young woman in the road. The cars headlights light her up and as she throws up her hands across her face you slam down the breaks and turn the car. With a loud screech the car skids across the road and narrowly misses the girl. You scream as the car spins around in full circle and with terrifying speed slides into the embankment and overturns with a crash.

You hit your head on the airbag and feel glass shatter across your face as the car comes to a halt at the bottom of the embankment. In agony you try to unfasten your seat belt and let go of a sudden a cry as you realise your right leg is pinned to the damaged chassis of the car.

"Help me!" you cry above the noise of the car and the storm. In the darkness, alone and afraid you try desperately to get free and suddenly hear your mobile phone. You grasp at the phone and scream for help to the recognisable voice of John. As he asks for directions and you try to give them you feel the signs of nausea and lose consciousness into an inky blackness...

You awake in a warm bed. Facing you is the welcoming face of John and his partner Mirrian. "How are you feeling," he asks, "You had us worried these last three days". You look at him in shock, three days. You tell him you have felt better.

"Thank god we found you alive when we did!" Mirrian says quietly. "You have missed some terrible news?" John tells Mirrian to leave her news for now but she hands you a local newspaper.

You read the headline in disbelief and look at the two faces of your friends. Several thousand now dead from plague. Army starts mass vaccination.

"When did all this happen?" you ask.
John tells you that the vaccination program started several days ago. Just after your crash. Unbelievably like some terrible disaster or horror movie the origins of the plague were unknown but the symptoms terrifying. The government had now declared martial law as those perishing from the disease were turning into undead.

Mirrian and John speak to you into the late hours of the evening. They inform you of the plague; how the hospitals are overrun with vacation programs and that a doctor had recommenced you stay at the cottage rather than the city. Vaccinated along with the others you had been left with John who himself is a doctor and his wife.
After discussions of the plague and the crash you are left to sleep until the morning.

100564.name: Piktee
100564.description:
A set collecting game. Cards are traded noisily until one player has at least five of one team. The first to do so cries "Piktee" and scores 50 points and claims the Free Kick card, and a new deal starts (the Free Kick card has no purpose at all so I do not know why it was included in the game).
If a player dares, he may not call out his 5 card team but he can wait to get a six card team. If he is still the first to call "Piktee" he will score double points but, of course, by waiting, someone else might call a team before him and he will not score.
The Penalty card is exactly that, a penalty card. If you are caught with it in your hand when "Piktee" is called, you lose 25 points.
The first player to score 500 points after several deals, wins.

100565.name: Garden of Bones
100565.description:
From the Background:

You hear the man behind you slowly draw his dagger. You spin around and strike the weapon from his hand with an upward swipe of your sword. The dagger spins high into the air. You kick the man in the chest and he falls onto his backside. A second later the dagger lands point-first in the ground between his legs.

He yelps in surprise and his brow glistens in the moonlight as you aim the point of your sword at his throat. "I'm sorry," he babbles. "B-b-but..."

You lower your sword and tell him with a laugh that if it was gold he sought he only had to ask. You toss him a gold piece. He catches the coin and looks in astonishment at the seal stamped upon it - that of Baron Sukumvit of Fang. "But these," he exclaims. "These are granted only to one who has survived the Trial..."

You laugh again and sheath your sword. The great riches that you recently acquired in Chiang Mai have indeed come in useful. Gold has bought you everything you ever wanted, except excitement.

Bored with your comfortable dwellings in Chiang Mai you travelled to the city of thieves, Port Blacksand, in search of adventure. Of the many tales you heard in the Black Lobster tavern, one in particular caught your interest. The next day you bought a leaky old boat and sailed down the ruddy waters of the Red River towards the Moonstone Hills. You stopped to buy supplies from the Dwarfs of Stonebridge, along with a sharp new sword. Sailing on you passed the twisted trees of Darkwood Forest and the blood-red peak of Firetop Mountain, before coming to moor at the humble village known as Barn.

The villagers were friendly enough; once they were satisfied you had not arrived on some wicked errand from nearby Darkwood. You quickly found a local man who could help you find what you were looking for. His eyes sparkled at the mention of gold. But his look quickly turned to one of horror when you told him exactly what you were searching for. It took several more coins and several more mugs of ale before he agreed to act as your guide. As night fell the two of you crossed the ferry north and followed a seldom used path by lantern-light, with bleak and lonely hills stretching away on either side, shrouded in moonlit mist.

You have only just arrived at your destination, a neglected graveyard surrounded by a low, crumbling stone wall and a pair of jagged iron gates. The church here apparently burnt down long ago. The rambling headstones that remain have since become so overgrown with weeds and wildflowers that the place has long been known among the locals as, "The Garden of Bones".

The tale you heard in Port Blacksand concerned events that took place over half a century ago. A warlock named Morbius Kane had struck a bargain with a Demon Prince to forge for him a weapon that would make Kane as mighty on the field of battle as he was in the field of magic. It is said that Kane was a man of great vanity and collected the skulls of his enemies as a way of recording the number of lives he had taken. The Demon knew this and promised Kane a weapon truly worthy of a conqueror such as he, a weapon that would never let him forget the number of lives he had harvested.

The Demon gave Morbius Kane a great spear, carved with runes that glowed like hellfire. The weapon increased its master's ability in combat to such a degree that now not even the mightiest of Kane's warriors could best him. Thus Morbius Kane grew demented with a lust for conquest, seeking more and more skulls to add to his monstrous collection. It was said that Morbius Kane swore upon his Spear that he not rest until he had claimed ten thousand Allansian lives.

He gathered an army of undead beings - Zombies, Skeleton Warriors, Ghouls, Wights and Crypt Stalkers - and with them ravaged the outlying lands. After months of bloodshed, Kane was eventually defeated by the Dwarfs of Stonebridge. In a ferocious battle their hearty leader, Gillibran, smote Kane dead with a blow from his magical hammer. Gillibran brought the Spear of Kane back to Stonebridge for examination. But the weapon was stolen in the night by Kane himself, who had returned from death to reclaim his weapon, bound by his own dreadful oath to claim ten thousand mortal lives.

In the following weeks the villagers of nearby Barn saw ghostly figures wandering the streets at night. Men were found dead, women and children disappeared and word finally reached the wizard Yaztromo in his great tower on the southern edge of Darkwood Forest. The old wizard arrived in Barn and cast a spell that took three days and three nights to perform. In this way he captured the undead Morbius Kane, along with every one of the warlock's followers. Needing a suitable prison in which to house these monsters, Yaztromo bound them within the nearby Garden of Bones, placing a spell around the graveyard that prevented any inside from ever escaping.

Yet legend has it that whenever the full moon shines upon the Garden of Bones its gates swing open once more. Though the undead remain trapped inside, it is possible for the living to enter their shadow realm. Many an adventurer has entered the Garden in search of the fabled Spear of Morbius Kane. None have returned - at least none alive.

The full moon now shines bright upon the Garden of Bones. A strange fog seems to billow from among the graves. You hear a metallic clink, followed by a slow, grinding creak as the gates swing open to greet you. Your guide scrambles to his feet, gibbering in terror, and dashes back towards the village.

It is said that once a living person enters the Garden of Bones they can never again find their way out. The writhing mist inside has a way of confounding one's sense of direction. But during your visit to Stonebridge you took the precaution of purchasing an enchanted lantern, which will light your way back to the land of the living.

The moon bathes your surroundings with silvery light. The cold mist now curling round your ankles also casts a pale glow. What a tale you will have to tell when you return to Stonebridge holding the legendary Spear of Kane. A sudden shiver ripples down your spine. Then again, it will not do to underestimate the task ahead of you. Gripping the hilt of your sword for reassurance you walk boldly into the Garden of Bones. The gates swing shut behind you like the iron jaws of death.

100566.name: Grim Holiday
100566.description:
From the Background:

Every year the Temples in Fang ring their bells of winter yore. In a rhythmic tune, the
bells chime slowly then quickly. Like a xylophone, each instrument echoes in separate
pounds, vibrant tolling sounds highlighting the festive evening. The temples are alight
with red, green and white lanterns; across the laneway the large tavern has decorated its
walls with the very similar art. The air not only sounds nice but smells of sweet
sandalwood incense. It seems to be yet another year like the last.
You stand there in the winter solstice, listen in, and watch the temple players. A group od
dancers dressed in heavy garb come out and take large steps. They look as though their
acting out a bear or massive beast. They start to dance amidst the onlookers. It has
starting to get colder so you decide to call it a night and return home in the Ming district.
Upon arriving there are soldiers on horseback and one empty horse, its rider is handing
your father a scroll. You hurry into your home as the soldiers depart. You ask what the
scroll is but he ignores you. Your mother tells you that he has been selected to venture
out into the Ice Fingers Mountains. Your father is partially crippled, although he could
walk from one end of Fang to the next there is no chance of his survival hiking the
mountains and possibly a mountain.
That evening and in silence, everyone ate their meal and went to bed. As you step by
your parent’s carrying with you a clay lantern with a tiny flame sticking out of the spout
you spy you father practicing Chi. He’s moving his hands and legs in perfect unison then
keels over in pain. His hip is hurting him again, and he stays in one spot for some time
until he recovers. He picks up the sword Sukumvit gave to him at the third Trial of
Champions. It is a magnificent piece, with a heart of steel, a head of rubies and
shimmering eyes. The sword looks as though it were made of blue steel. It is nearly light
as a feather. He shakes his head and frowns. You can see him fighting the tears that he’s
no longer the champion he used to be.
That night as you lie in bed, you cannot help but feel anxious. You are not trained in the
art of swordsmanship like you father but you do know how to use one, you are not the
proper age since you are only a teenager, and you are the wrong gender but that doesn’t
matter to you now. You don’t want your father to go. All of these three things could alter
your outcome, but your father is not in faultless shape.
You get up and tiptoe through the chilly house and quietly slide open their door and
sneak the sword and scroll and return to your room. The scroll reads that there is a
danger, unlike any other danger lurking ever closer toward the town. A few selected in
Zengis are setting out to the Ice Finger Mountains to destroy a madman called Father
Grim Holiday who is rumoured to be creating hideous objects for this year’s Winter
Festivals, some of which are finding their way down the pass already. You have read
enough. Your father is not going, you reason. Quickly, you go to his wardrobe, and put
on his warrior uniform. Although you do not know what you are doing, you have decided
to guess you way through; it has always worked before, why not now?

100567.name: Mythweaver: Reckoning Players' Guide
100567.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free, updated and simplified players' guide for Mythweaver: Reckoning provides a streamlined overview of the three core archetypes for the game, notes on character building, selecting a race, and purchasing traits and talents. The guide includes 9 sample characters to use as models for your own or as NPCs in ongoing games.

100568.name: Army Ants Resolute Edition Core Rules (4th Edition)
100568.description:
From publisher blurb:

The little game of big military insect adventure is ready to rock your world! This streamlined game uses the popular Resolute game engine (based on 2D6 + ability) to resolve all situations. This core rulebook includes guidelines for making an ant grunt, rules for how to resolve common situations, and an introductory adventure to get you started right away.

100569.name: Army Ants Resolute Referee's Guide (4th Edition)
100569.description:
From publisher blurb:

This handy guide gives suggestions for running games in the world of Michael T. Desing's Army Ants, using the Army Ants Resolute edition rules.

100570.name: Resolute: The Splintered Realm
100570.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, hero. Your help is needed in this dire time.

Darkness surrounds us, and we summoned it. Although our goddess provided for all of our needs, empowering us to drive evil from the realm, we wanted more. We looked at Yahalla, our true goddess, and saw a distant queen of unlimited power rather than the kind mother who watched over us. We saw a chance to grasp the gauntlet of immortality, and bartered our entire world to claim it. The Reckoning that followed her death unmade the borders of all lands, casting us into a realm of chaos.

The ruins of our forebears surround us. Great cities lie in ash, the mighty palaces of the old kings overrun with evil. An epoch of learning and progress has come to nothing, its great works claimed by vile creatures and savage beasts.

It falls to us to rise up and recover what has been lost. The Splintered Realm cries out for heroes. Will you answer the call?

100571.name: White Wolf Quarterly (Volume 3.1 - Winter 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Howlings: News and Notes from White Wolf
100571.description:
Contents:

2 HOWLINGS: NEWS AND NOTES FROM WHITE WOLF
2 CALENDAR OF EVENTS
2 EARLY AWAKENING
Developer Bill Bridges answers a few questions about this summer’s Mage: The Awakening. But just a few — what a tease!
4 OF WOLF AND MOON
The second of the core World of Darkness games is upon us. Developer Ethan Skemp looks to the moon and howls about Werewolf: The Forsaken.
7 MOUNTAINS BY MOONLIGHT
Developer Matthew McFarland takes us into the mountains with the
signature setting book for Werewolf, Hunting Ground: The Rockies. Don’t feed the animals…
8 THE ARCHITECTS OF THE MONOLITH
Author Bradley Robins reveals one of the secretive blood-families presented in March’s Bloodlines: The Hidden.
10 DEBTS OF BLOOD
The second Vampire: The Requiem novel hits shelves and takes it to the streets of Chicago in Lucien Soulban’s Blood In, Blood Out.
10 HOWLS IN THE DARK
Rick Jones’ Heart of the Hunter, the first novel in the Werewolf: The Forsaken series, brings the savagery to life.
11 A BEAUTIFUL WORLD
Take a look at Sonja Blue’s haunted world in this excerpt from
Nancy A. Collins’ Paint It Black.
12 THE ARTS OF THE DEAD
Exalted developer Geoffrey C. Grabowski exposes some of the dark secrets of necromancy coming up in Book of Bone and Ebony.
14 MORE THAN DAMNED
Kindred Most Wanted, the new set for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle, brings an even nastier edge to the card table. Developer L. Scott Johnson brands us anathema.
15 WARGHOULATOR!
VTES’s top player, Stéphane Lavrut, shows us one of his most successful decks.
16 A CHALLENGE TO CHERISH
Alex Teodorescu-Badia, Master Storyteller of the Camarilla fan club, lets us in on the development of the club’s new live-action chronicle for the new World of Darkness.
18 PRODUCTS FOR JANUARY
18 PRODUCTS FOR FEBRUARY
19 PRODUCTS FOR MARCH
21 BACKLIST

100572.name: Hold of the Heartless
100572.description:
From the Background:

Long have you travelled and many are the dangers you have faced to reach this point... at last you have found the Keep of the Succubus!

You look upon the tall stone wall of the keep grimly, knowing that you must confront the terrible seducer of men and make her pay for what she has done. Once the lines of kings were strong and proud - now there is no king. Once the noblemen trained knights to defend the people. Now there are no noblemen and no knights. All have fallen for her spell, this fell witch, this terrible sorceress.

100573.name: Sword & Sorcery Insider (Volume 3.1 - Winter 2005)
rpg: World of Warcraft: The Roleplaying Game
100573.description:
Contents:

2 The Inside Scoop: News and Notes From Sword & Sorcery Studios
4 Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved
The Next Step
Monte Cook introduces us to Arcana Evolved, his all-new “director’s cut” of his acclaimed variant player’s handbook. I hear the audio commentary track is a riot!
7 DragonMech
A World Under Lunar Rain
Joseph Goodman and Matt Sprengler introduce Second Age of Walkers, the sourcebook detailing the world of DragonMech. There’s more than thundering steam- and magic-powered war machines in store (but there are those, too!).
6 Spotlight On… Aracana Evolved race: The dracha
8 Warcraft RPG
100% Pure Warcraft
World of Warcraft: The Roleplaying Game releases in April, but we can’t wait! Developer Mike Johnstone offers a preview of the secrets the new rulebook will contain. A hint: no PHB required!
10 Spotlight On… Warcraft RPG race: Night elves
11 Necromancer Games
Into the Dark Woods
Necromancer Games puts the fear of dark forests back into your game in Glades of Death. I knew I shouldn’t have taken that short cut to Grandmother’s house….
12 EverQuest II RPG
How do you Spell “Freeport”?
EQIIrpg developer Stewart Wieck unveils details about Freeport, one of the two cities where the civilized races gather in the Shattered Lands. This and more in January’s EverQuest II RPG Spell Guide.
14 Products for January
15 Products for March
16 Backlist

100574.name: White Wolf Quarterly (Volume 3.2 - Spring 2005)
100574.description:
White Wolf Quarterly
Volume 3.2
Spring 2005

Cover by Daniel Brereton

100575.name: Sword & Sorcery Insider (Volume 3.2 - Spring 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Tricks of the Mech Jockey's Trade
rpg: World of Warcraft: The Roleplaying Game
100575.description:
Sword & Sorcery Insider
Volume 3.2
Spring 2005

Cover by Cory Allemeier

100576.name: The Compass of Celestial Directions, Vol. VI: Autochthonia
100576.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long forgotten by the people of Creation, the inventor of Exaltation still lives and slumbers behind ancient seals. His body is a vast industrial miracle, populated by the descendants of refugees and abductees from the First Age. These Autochthonians have established eight mighty nations, empowered the Alchemical Exalted as their champions, and mastered secrets of mystical artifice long lost to Creation. But now their god and world is dying in the dark of Elsewhere, casting the Eight Nations into the crucible. Will the innovation and prowess of the Alchemical Exalted be sufficient to save Autochthonia, or is a return to Creation the Great Maker's only hope?

This book includes:

Details on each of the Eight Nations of Autochthonia, the oldest surviving human cultures in the world of Exalted.
An examination of the Reaches-the untamed body of a Primordial - and the mortals who carve out a living in that deadly frontier far from the safety of the Eight Nations.
Traits for Autochthonia's storied heroes, mechanical denizens, and Exalted legends.

100577.name: Tormenta (Issue 10 - Apr 2002)
100577.description:
Table of Contents

2 - Kings The Thieves' Guild
8 - For our Gods!
22 - Realms of the Gods
26 - Comic Forever Arton
30 - Necromancer Answers

100578.name: Tormenta (Issue 11 - Jun 2002)
100578.description:
Table of Contents

2 - Gorendill Fruits and Drinks
4 - Half-Dryad
10 - Ways of Magic Elemental Magic
18 - Kings Part 2
26 - Comic
30 - Necromancer Answers

100579.name: Tormenta (Issue 12 - Aug 2002)
100579.description:
Table of Contents

2 - Tormenta D20
4 - Servants of Tormenta
10 - High-Priests
20 - Minions
26 - Comic Stone's Way
30 - Necromancer Answers

100580.name: A-Train 9
100580.description:
User Summary

A-Train 9 is a game in the A-Train series of train simulation titles. A-Train 9 builds on the basis provided by the earlier games, and expands on the simulation options.

Improvements include:

- more impressive navigation capabilities. Users can scroll to any spot on the map in an instant.
- Buses and trucks have been introduced as options for corporate expansion.
- Buildings have been given a more realistic appearance, and Japanese castles are introduced for the first time.

100581.name: Carnage Heart EXA
100581.description:
User Summary

Carnage Heart EXA is a sequel to Carnage Heart. Players are put in charge of an Overkill Engine mech (OKE) during a futuristic war. The mechs are used to fight the war autonomously, and are guided by command chain programs on chips. The player needs to design their command chain before battle, and may not interfere during combat.

Ad-hoc multiplayer is available for up to 6 players.

100582.description:
Ten Scenarios for ASL that are quite short. All Scenarios are presented in full color (even the map depiction).

The Scenarios included are:
Close Encounter of the Bad Kind [FT160]
French Civil War in Gabon [FT161]
Assault on District Rovno [FT162]
Price of Persia [FT163]
Guts are Not Enough [FT164]
Shopino Struggle [FT165]
Heroes at Leros [FT166]
Wasp Sting [FT167]
By Dawn's Early Light [FT168]
Daring Parafroggers [FT169]
100582.name: From the Cellar: Pack 6

100583.description:
This FTC pack for ASL comes with 14 scenarios, 2 articles and the corrected version of map LFT II.

The 14 Scenarios in this pack:
Bridge of Life [FT146]
Flight of the Intruders [FT147]
La Horgne [FT148]
Tombés pour la France [FT149]
Storm over Champagne [FT150]
Get Them Out! [FT151]
Avanti! [FT152]
Nailed to the Ground [FT153]
First Defeat [FT154]
Once upon a Time... in the East [FT155]
Leonov's Hill [FT156]
The Lost Column [FT157]
Close Combat Teams [FT158]
Tangled at Tsangkou [FT159]
100583.name: From the Cellar: Pack 5

100585.name: A-Train DS
100585.description:
User Summary

A-Train DS is a train simulation title that brings the series to the DS. Players are given control of a train company and are able to design a transportation network.

100586.name: Guild Wars 2
videogamehonor: 2010 Gamescom Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
2012 Gamescom Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Video Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Massively Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2016 PAX Curse Award Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
100586.description:
User Summary:

The game takes place in the Guild Wars fantasy world of Tyria, 250 years after the players defeated the Great Destroyer in the "Eye of the North" expansion. Five elder dragons sleeping beneath the continent have awoken, causing widespread destruction to Tyria and corrupting its inhabitants.

Guild Wars 2 brings the storytelling of RPGs into the MMO realm, and has a story filled with choices that allow you to play through the game many times and see different story lines and twists every time.

"Quests" as you know them are gone, and instead there are "events". These events happens in real-time in the game, and you can join up as they happen. Depending on the outcome, the world will change accordingly, and a new event will be triggered from that.
Any person you meet in Tyria is a potential ally, as you no longer need to join a group with someone to play with them. You will also receive the same rewards, when you play several people together, as you would, if you were playing all alone. So... - no one can steal kills, or loot from you anymore!

100587.name: Macross: Ace Frontier
100587.description:
Macross Ace Frontier is a shooting game developed by Artdink for the PlayStation Portable. The game is based on Studio Nue's popular Macross series, one of which is known in the West as the first generation of Robotech. It features original elements as well as characters, mechanics, episode plots and BGM borrowed from 1982's The Super Dimension Fortress Macross original TV series, the 1992 Macross Plus OVA series, the 1994 Macross 7 TV series and the 2008 Macross Frontier TV series, as well as incorporating more elements from the 1984 Macross: Do You Remember Love? feature film and the 2002 prequel OVA series Macross Zero.

Gameplay

It is a 3D shooter action game with multiplayer capability (1 - 4 Players) over the PSP ad-hoc feature. It features various characters and mecha from the last 25 years of the series, ranging from the VF-1 Valkyrie up to the most recent variable fighter craft in the Macross universe, including the VF-25 Messiah and also featuring the VF-0, the VF-19 Custom Fire Valkyrie as well as various enemy class mecha from Zentradi, Varauta, Anti-UN and Vajra forces. The game was developed using the Gundam Battle engine.

Source: Wikipedia, "Macross Ace Frontier", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100588.name: Fortified Zone
100588.description:
Fortified Zone (怒りの要塞 Ikari no Yōsai?, "The Fortress of Fury") is a video game developed by Jaleco and released worldwide for the Game Boy on February 26, 1991.

Story

Fortified Zone's plot follows two Mercenaries named Masato Kanzaki and Mizuki Makimura as they infiltrate a literal fortified zone, where they must take on mercenaries, soldiers, robots and monsters before destroying the central complex at the fortified zone's heart.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fortified Zone", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100589.name: Gomoku Narabe Renju
100589.description:
Gomoku Narabe Renju (五目ならべ?, "5 Points in a Row") is a Japan-exclusive video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System (in addition to the Virtual Console) which is based on the board game Connect Five.

This game can be found in pirated multicarts under a numerous amount of alternative titles like Chinese Chess and Five Chess. Many of them can be downloaded on the Internet in addition to being purchased at flea markets. Notable examples are Power Player Super Joy III and Game Stick; both of them are bootleg devices that are meant to be hooked up to the player's television in some manner.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gomoku Narabe Renju", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100590.name: Brave Story: New Traveler
100590.description:
Brave Story: New Traveler is a video game loosely based in the world of the novel and manga Brave Story. It was released in Japan on July 6, 2006. An English version, published and localized by Xseed Games, was released on July 31, 2007 in North America.

The game starts off with the player as the main protagonist, called Tatsuya as the default name, and introduces us to his best friend, whose default name is Miki. The story kicks off with Tatsuya and Miki sitting on a bench. Tatsuya is too immersed in the game he is playing on his PSP to notice that Miki is missing. Kratos, Miki's dog, barks and shows Tatsuya where Miki is and thus he finds her unconscious on the ground, sick by some unknown illness. He wishes for her to become better, and suddenly, a voice magically appears and asks Tatsuya if he wants to save his friend and make her healthy again. He agrees and thus the adventure begins in an unknown land separated from the rest of the world in order to seize 5 different gems for the Traveler's Sword he holds so he can return to his own world and restore Miki back to good health.

The game is based on the Japanese novel Brave Story by Miyuki Miyabe, and features some of the original cast, although the main characters Tatsuya and Miki (as well as most of Tatsuya's party) are original creations for the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Brave Story: New Traveler", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100591.name: Championship Manager Season 01/02
videogamehonor: 2001 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
100591.description:
Championship Manager: Season 01/02 is a football management computer game in the Sports Interactive's Championship Manager series. It was released in October 2001 exclusively for PC and for Mac in November 2001. It was also later released on Xbox in April 2002.

New Features

Although never particularly expanding on the graphical side, Sports Interactive included many new features along with the usual updated database. Championship Manager 01/02 implemented the new EU regulated transfer system, introduced in September 2001, and also featured a new attribute masking mode, whereby the player could only see information about footballers he/she would realistically know about (also known as a fog of war).

Other new additions included the ability to send players away for surgery, player notes, player comparisons, and improved media and board interaction.

Source: Wikipedia, "Championship Manager: Season 01/02", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100592.name: Bureau - Agent Kendall
100592.description:
User Summary:

A text-based adventure involving FBI agents. Puzzle solving and deductive reasoning are peppered with timed action sequences in this well-written Indie Game. This game has higher quality graphics than the average Indie, but has a playing time of about two hours. Contains sexual themes.

100593.name: Blaster and Amethyst
100593.description:
User Summary

Blaster and Amethyst is a simple top down shooting game. There are seven gems in each stage, and the player must collect all of them to gain access to the next room. A number of enemies will shoot at the player, and if they hit, the player will be thrown backwards. If the player falls off the edge of the stage, they will lose a life.

The player has a blaster gun that they use to defeat enemies and propel around the stage.

100594.name: Sentient
100594.description:
Sentient is a first-person adventure developed by Psygnosis and released on the PlayStation in 1997. It was also released for the PC the same year.

Gameplay

There has been a breakout of radiation sickness on Space Station Icarus, the player has been sent to investigate. After arriving at the station, it becomes apparent that radiation is only one of many problems; the Captain is dead and a power struggle has ensued. To make matters worse, Icarus is on a collision course with the Sun and nobody is able to correct the station's course. Sentient takes place in real-time, the player's actions in the early part of the game determine which path they will travel through later on. Which members of the crew are spoken to and what they are told plays a strong part in the plot's development. The player's performance through the game determines which of the nine endings they receive

Development

The game was developed by Psygnosis' external Chester Studio over 1996 and 1997. The characters in the game were based on facial scans of staff at the studio.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sentient (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100595.name: Blulu
100595.description:
An arithmetically paired fishing game with the Decktet.

In the Eastern Deserts, the jackrabbits are regarded as a pest and a delicacy. Lesser known is that between eating (and being eaten) they while away their time with a simple fishing game.

As a fishing game, the goal of the game is to capture cards. Each player will play two cards every turn, capturing cards using either the sum or difference of the played cards. The players that captures the most cards scores points for the round. The first player to reach twenty-two points wins the game and is granted the privilege to be the first bunny out for dinner.

The game is a reinvention of the classic Moroccan fishing game Ronda. Aside from using the Decktet instead of the Latin Deck, the game is also played with two cards at a time and bonuses are given for suit combinations played.

100596.description:
A feeding frenzy for two bunnies.

This is a simple fishing game of capturing cards off the tableau. The game starts with an 8x3 grid of cards face up on the table. After splitting the undealt cards (using a split the pie mechanism) the players capture cards by playing one or more cards whose rank adds up equal or higher than the card being captured. Each of the capturing cards must share a suit with the card being taken. After the tableau is cleared, the players add up the values of their captured cards to determine the winner.

Even though the game was designed as a light game, it is almost completely a perfect information game. The only moment where there is not perfect information is when the players determine the split of the hand -- and even then they can figure out which cards the opponent is splitting. As such it could be played as a very memory heavy, intense, spatial game.

The game was inspired by the designer's pet rabbit who is by far the most enthusiastic and fastest eating bunny the designer has ever seen. The girl has no problems yanking food right out of her partner's mouth, but is readily aggrieved if she does not get her fair share of the produce.
100596.name: Pepper. Corn!

100597.name: WWF Wrestlemania (1988)
100597.description:
WWF WrestleMania (named after the annual pay-per-view event) is an NES game created by Rare and published by Acclaim Entertainment in 1988. It was the first WWF licensed NES game, meaning it features actual WWF wrestlers as opposed to fictional characters like previous wrestling games. WrestleMania also marked the beginning of a long relationship between Acclaim and the WWF which lasted twelve years.

The game features six wrestlers: Hulk Hogan, André the Giant, "Macho Man" Randy Savage, The Honky Tonk Man, Bam Bam Bigelow, and "The Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase.

Gameplay

All wrestlers possess a limited amount of moves, which comprise of basic standing punches and kicks, headbutts, a running attack, a move off the turnbuckle (which André the Giant and Bam Bam Bigelow cannot perform), and a bodyslam (which Bam Bam Bigelow and Honky Tonk Man cannot perform).
